Name: Weight for Fishing
Description: The fishing weight is an oval stone with a hollow strip in the middle to be attached by a string to the net. It is the same shape as a pulley. This kind of weight was depicted in fishing scenes on the walls of Old Kingdom tombs. The weights are shown attached to a large net, three on each side; eight fishermen, standing on a boat made of papyrus plants, hold the net, which is full of various kinds of fish.
